alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:58PM EDT until August 15 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN JOHNSTON COUNTY... At 458 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Smithfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Clayton, Micro, Selma, Pine Level, Kenly, Emit, Flowers and Buckhorn Reservoir. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
